importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the incident is critical for understanding the timeline of the event and for public awareness and reporting.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time when police responded to the scene indicates the urgency and immediacy of the incident, which is vital for emergency response protocols and public safety planning.

keyTakeAways: An argument at a private off-campus party escalated into a shooting outside an Oklahoma State University residence hall, wounding three people including a student.
Two victims were hospitalized in stable condition after surgery, and the third was treated and released.
No arrests have been made, but police have 'some solid leads' and are asking for public assistance.
Investigators do not believe there’s an ongoing threat to the campus or public.
The shooting occurred in an outdoor hallway at the Carreker East student apartments and spilled into a parking lot and nearby street, following a 'disagreement between several people' at the party.
Officers responded after a report of a person collapsing from injuries at a McDonald’s restaurant and calls of shots on campus.
When officers arrived at about 3:40 a.m., no victims remained at the scene.
Officers secured the area and took about 20 people present to a secure location for their safety and to begin interviews.
The university is located in the city of Stillwater, about 50 miles (80 kilometers) northeast of Oklahoma City.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The incident occurred on campus, specifically outside a student residence hall, linking the event directly to the university's environment and student community.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Highlights that a student was among the injured, underscoring the personal impact on the university community and student well-being.

summaryOfNewsArticle: An argument at a private off-campus party at Oklahoma State University escalated into a shooting outside the Carreker East student apartments, resulting in three injuries, including one student. Two victims were hospitalized in stable condition after surgery, while the third was treated and released. Police responded after a person collapsed at a McDonald’s restaurant and reports of shots on campus. Officers arrived at approximately 3:40 a.m. and found no victims remaining at the scene. No arrests have been made, though investigators have 'some solid leads' and are seeking public assistance. The university police chief, Michael Beckner, confirmed there is no ongoing threat to campus or public safety. The incident occurred in Stillwater, about 50 miles northeast of Oklahoma City.
title: Shooting at Oklahoma State University Residence Hall Leaves Three Wounded
